result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L Hogan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross. - Bond applied paid in full.

Early discharge after 12 months if all conditions are met and upon the approval of the agent
No conditional jail requested.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amanda L Hogan in court with attorney William George Weiland. Defendant Amanda L Hogan in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:30 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the Revocation packet(s) and Warrant
Neither party has any corrections to the Revocation Packet
Assistant DA argues regarding sentencing
Attorney for the defendant argues regarding sentencing
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to the sentencing after revocation

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
180 days jail
Time served sentence
**Fines and costs have been paid in full
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 2, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Amanda L Hogan
Current: 201 Prentice Street North, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 04-12-2016)
Prior: 341 17th Avenue North, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54495 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Amanda L Hogan
Current: 341 17th Avenue North, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54495 United States  (Effective: 03-31-2016)
Prior: 664 Main St, Junction City, WI 54443

Defendant Amanda L Hogan in court with attorney Benjamin Krautkramer on behalf of Scott A Swid. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:55 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Swid makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Sentence withheld
Placed on Probation for 24 months
Early discharge after 12 months if all conditions are met and upon the approval of the agent
No conditional jail requested
Pay fine of $1,500.00 plus costs (includes DNA Surcharge)

**$5,000.00 cash bond posted to be applied to the fine/costs and remaining monies to be returned to the poster

Defendant Amanda L Hogan in court with attorney Scott A Swid. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Arraignment:
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Amanda L Hogan in court with attorney Scott A Swid. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and is read in Court.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits are waived.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

1:26 PM Court calls case.

ADA  Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Escape.
Defendant was presently serving a jail sentence in 13CT-299, released for employment, did not return after employment, a warrant was issued and taken into custody in Wood County.

Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a large cash bond of $10,000 with conditions as stated.
Defendant addresses the Court, is enrolled in school in Stevens Point, has two minor children living with her, is 6 months pregnant, would like to get out. Defendant can do a $1,500 cash bond.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  March 9, 2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3

Defendant is remanded to custody of sheriff pending posting of bail.
Court advises Defendant to contact public defender's office.
